evidence_span: Outside surface oxides in removed pressure tubes were also examined (Table 2: Row 7). These had been exposed to reactor gas annuli $( \mathbf { N } _ { 2 }$ or $\mathbf { C O } _ { 2 } )$ at ${ \sim } 3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ with ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ partial pressures ranging from ${ \sim } 0 . 2 5$ to ${ \sim } 2 0 0 ~ \mathrm { P a }$ and $\mathbf { D } _ { 2 }$ partial pressures between ${ \sim } 1 0$ and $1 0 0 \ \mathbf { P a }$ for up to 13 years.

conditions.atmosphere: D2O partial pressure ~0.25 to ~200 Pa, D2 partial pressure ~10 to 100 Pa

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: A thin sample of $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ was exposed to $1 \times 1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ Pa of ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ vapor at $3 8 0 \mathrm { { ^ \circ C } }$ for $3 6 0 \ \mathrm { h }$ to determine the rate of permeation into the bulk alloy (Table 2: Row 8). Practically no deuterium in the bulk alloy was detected by DSC following this exposure.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: Samples of $\mathbf { Z r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ exposed to a gaseous environment consisting of predominantly deuterium gas $( 1 0 ^ { - 3 } \ \mathbf { P a } )$ with only $1 0 ^ { - 5 }$ Pa ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ at $3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $4 8 \mathrm { { h } }$ (Table 2: Row 3) exhibited lower deuterium concentration at the surface and within the oxide as shown in Fig. 1. The resulting bulk alloy deuterium uptake was still below detectability.

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: However, when samples were exposed to the same gaseous environment at $3 8 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ (to accelerate uptake) for $^ { 3 3 0 \mathrm { h } }$ , a significant uptake by the bulk alloy was observed (Table 2: Row 9).

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: Following sample exposure, bulk alloy deuterium uptake was $\sim 1 2 \ \mu \bf { g } / c m ^ { 2 }$ determined by DSC.

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk8
evidence_span: M. B. Elmoselhi et al. (authors' closure)—My comment that there may be some similarities in the mechanism of hydrogen transport through the oxide of Zircaloy-2 and $\mathbf { Z  r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ is in terms of the transporting species and the mechanistic modeling of the transport process, for example, steps such as dissociation, adsorption, diffusion, etc. may be common for the two systems.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk8
evidence_span: M. B. Elmoselhi et al. (authors'closure)—My comment that there may be some similarities in the mechanism of hydrogen transport through the oxide of Zircaloy-2 and $\mathbf { Z  r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ is in terms of the transporting species and the mechanistic modeling of the transport process, for example, steps such as dissociation, adsorption, diffusion, etc. may be common for the two systems.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk8
evidence_span: However, the differences in terms of the microstructure such as the presence of intermetalics (acting as short-circuit routes) in Zircaloy-2 oxides and the effect of the twophase structure of $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ on its oxide properties are certainly recognized
